pullRequest.title: WantAuthnRequestsSigned IDPSSODescriptor is not configurable in resident IDP. #7323
pullRequest.bodyText:
…ptor is not configurable in resident IDP. #7323
Proposed changes in this pull request
wso2/product-is#7323



When should this PR be merged
[Please describe any preconditions that need to be addressed before we
can merge this pull request.]
Follow up actions
[List any possible follow-up actions here; for instance, testing data
migrations, software that we need to install on staging and production
environments.]
Add the following property s to the identity.xml file reside in the <IS_HOME>/repository/conf/identity folder under SSOService
 <SAML2AuthnRequestsSigningEnabled>false</SAML2AuthnRequestsSigningEnabled>




Checklist (for reviewing)
General

 Is this PR explained thoroughly? All code changes must be accounted for in the PR description.
 Is the PR labeled correctly?

Functionality

 Are all requirements met? Compare implemented functionality with the requirements specification.
 Does the UI work as expected? There should be no Javascript errors in the console; all resources should load. There should be no unexpected errors. Deliberately try to break the feature to find out if there are corner cases that are not handled.

Code

 Do you fully understand the introduced changes to the code? If not ask for clarification, it might uncover ways to solve a problem in a more elegant and efficient way.
 Does the PR introduce any inefficient database requests? Use the debug server to check for duplicate requests.
 Are all necessary strings marked for translation? All strings that are exposed to users via the UI must be marked for translation.

Tests

 Are there sufficient test cases? Ensure that all components are tested individually; models, forms, and serializers should be tested in isolation even if a test for a view covers these components.
 If this is a bug fix, are tests for the issue in place?  There must be a test case for the bug to ensure the issue won’t regress. Make sure that the tests break without the new code to fix the issue.
 If this is a new feature or a significant change to an existing feature? has the manual testing spreadsheet been updated with instructions for manual testing?

Security

 Confirm this PR doesn't commit any keys, passwords, tokens, usernames, or other secrets.
 Are all UI and API inputs run through forms or serializers?
 Are all external inputs validated and sanitized appropriately?
 Does all branching logic have a default case?
 Does this solution handle outliers and edge cases gracefully?
 Are all external communications secured and restricted to SSL?

Documentation

 Are changes to the UI documented in the platform docs? If this PR introduces new platform site functionality or changes existing ones, the changes should be documented.
 Are changes to the API documented in the API docs? If this PR introduces new API functionality or changes existing ones, the changes must be documented.
 Are reusable components documented? If this PR introduces components that are relevant to other developers (for instance a mixin for a view or a generic form) they should be documented in the Wiki.

commit.message: WantAuthnRequestsSigned, NameIDFormat & more elements in IDPSSODescriptor is not configurable in resident IDP. #7323

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -433,6 +433,11 @@ script.default.seq.placeholder=Please add a default authentication sequence conf
 saml.metadata.validity.period=Metadata Validity Period
 saml.metadata.validity.period.help=Set the SAML metadata validity period in minutes
 saml.metadata.signing.enabled=Enable metadata signing
+saml.metadata.wantAuthnRequests.signing.enabled= Enable AuthnRequestsSigned
+saml.metadata.name.id.format=NameIDFormat
+saml.metadata.attribute.profile= Attribute Profile
+
+

nodes.bodyText: Do we need default value for this? Can't we comment this?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -577,6 +577,8 @@
         <!-- Request validity period in minutes-->
         <SAML2AuthenticationRequestValidityPeriod>5</SAML2AuthenticationRequestValidityPeriod>
         <SAMLSPCertificateExpiryValidationEnabled>false</SAMLSPCertificateExpiryValidationEnabled>
+        <NameIDFormat>urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:nameid-format:transient</NameIDFormat>
+        <AttributeProfile>http://sample.com</AttributeProfile>

nodes.bodyText: same changes need to go to identity.xml.j2.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -577,6 +577,8 @@
         <!-- Request validity period in minutes-->
         <SAML2AuthenticationRequestValidityPeriod>5</SAML2AuthenticationRequestValidityPeriod>
         <SAMLSPCertificateExpiryValidationEnabled>false</SAMLSPCertificateExpiryValidationEnabled>
+        <NameIDFormat>urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:nameid-format:transient</NameIDFormat>
+        <AttributeProfile>http://sample.com</AttributeProfile>

nodes.bodyText: formatting issue. address this in every other instance of this PR
Can't we use here the constant defined in IdentityApplicationConstants class for "WantAuthnRequestsSigned"?
Can't we assign SAML_METADATA_WANT_AUTHN_REQUESTS_SIGNED_DEFAULT constant defined in IdentityApplicationConstants class for this?
Let's use the previously defined constants for "NameIDFormat" and "AttributeProfile"
remove the redundant line fix formatting issues

commit.message: Fixing formating issues and Removing NameIDFormat and AttrinutePRofile implementation

nodes.bodyText: let's make M upper case in the resource value. it should be 'Enable Metadata Signing'
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -432,9 +432,11 @@ title.add.default.seq.select.mode=Select Mode
 script.default.seq.placeholder=Please add a default authentication sequence configuration in XML
 saml.metadata.validity.period=Metadata Validity Period
 saml.metadata.validity.period.help=Set the SAML metadata validity period in minutes
-saml.metadata.signing.enabled=Enable metadata signing
+saml.metadata.signing.enabled=Enable metadata Signing

nodes.bodyText: this change seems unnecessary. Let's revert it
Can we use the defined constant(SAML_METADATA_AUTHN_REQUESTS_SIGNING_ENABLED) here
